general_advisory: In paddy crop, Panicle initiation, Panicle emergence, flowering and milking stages are the critical stages. Cover the rows with dry leaves in Sugarcane. Apply sprinkler irrigation to bring down the heat effect. Irrigate the maize crop. Spread polythene in irrigation channels. Wilting in tomato and brinjal. Mulch coconut leaves. Cover with paper caps on newly planted vegetable seedlings. Harvest fingerlings in shallow ponds. Yellow stem borer management in paddy. Blast disease management. Tobacco caterpillar management. Early shoot borer management in sugarcane. Brinjal shoot and fruit borer management. Whitefly infestation in okra. Post-harvest practices for onion. Mango hopper management.

advisory: Panicle initiation, Panicle emergence, flowering and milking stages are the critical stages. Water deficit during these stages should be avoided.
Cover the rows with dry leaves. Top-dress with 4% potassium. Apply sprinkler irrigation.
Irrigate the crop. Never allow water to remain stagnant for more than six hours.
Apply 1g Streptocyclin in 10 liter water in root zone.
Install pheromone trap. Spray neem-based pesticide or chemical control.
Cover with paper caps during day time.
Check caterpillars migration. Dust with Chlorpyriphos. Chemical control by spraying insecticides.
Treat seeds with Imidacloprid. Install yellow sticky traps.
Cut tops after harvesting. Dry bulbs in well-ventilated area for storage.
Spray insecticides for pest control. Use smoke below plants.
